abstract: In the age of information overload, perhaps the answer is accepting that you can’t keep up.
snippet: In the age of information overload, perhaps the answer is accepting that you can’t keep up.
lead_paragraph: As the number of ways to interact and share information with everyone we know (and don’t know) multiplies, those of us who spend our days wired are feeling more and more behind. Between blogs, Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Digg, and the next new social networking communication enhancer, suddenly e-mail is just one of the online “mailboxes” we have to tend.
